title: Social Media Manager / Content Creator (Female) Job at Bonzee Consulting
content:
Bonzee Consulting - Our client is recruiting suitable candidates to fill the position below:

Job Position: Social Media Manager / Content Creator (Female)

Job Location: Lekki Phase 1, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
Work Mode: Hybrid (Once or twice a week)
Industry: Home and Lifestyle luxury

Job Summary
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Our client is seeking a highly skilled and experienced Social Media Manager to lead our social media strategy and execution.
	The successful candidate will be responsible for developing and implementing a comprehensive social media strategy that aligns with our business goals and objectives.


Key Responsibilities


	Develop and implement social media strategy: Create and execute a social media strategy that aligns with our business goals and objectives.
	Manage social media accounts: Manage and maintain our social media presence across multiple platforms, including Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, LinkedIn, and YouTube.
	Create engaging content: Develop and curate high-quality, engaging content that resonates with our target audience.
	Build and grow online communities: Build and grow our online communities by responding to comments, messages, and reviews in a timely and professional manner.
	Monitor and analyze performance metrics: Monitor and analyze social media performance metrics, including engagement rates, follower growth, and conversions.
	Run social media ads: Plan, execute, and optimize social media ads to drive website traffic, generate leads, and boost sales.
	Collaborate with cross-functional teams: Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including marketing, communications, and customer service, to ensure alignment and maximize impact.
	Stay up-to-date with industry trends: Stay up-to-date with the latest social media trends, best practices, and platform changes.


Requirements


	A Bachelor's Degree in Marketing, Communications, or a related field is required.
	A minimum of 2 years of experience in social media management is required.
	A proven track record of success in developing and executing social media strategies that drive engagement, conversions, and sales.
	Excellent communication and writing skills are required.
	Experience with social media management tools, such as Hootsuite, Sprout Social, or Buffer, is required.
	Knowledge of social media advertising platforms, such as Facebook Ads Manager or LinkedIn Ads, is essential.


Salary
N200,000 - N250,000 per month.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: Careers@bonzeeconsulting.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

title: Internal Auditor Job at Interswitch
content:
Interswitch is an Africa-focused integrated digital payments and commerce company that facilitates the electronic circulation of money as well as the exchange of value between individuals and organisations on a timely and consistent basis. We started operations in 2002 as a transaction switching and electronic payments processing, and have progressively evolved into an integrated payment services company, building and managing payment infrastructure as well as delivering innovative payment products and transactional services throughout the African continent. At Interswitch, we offer unique career opportunities for individuals capable of playing key roles and adding value in an innovative and fun environment.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



Job Position: Internal Auditor

Job Location: Lagos

Job Summary


	Reporting to the Div. Head, Business Process and Shared Services Audit, the Internal Auditor will execute assurance, and other internal audit engagements testing as part of the annual risk-based internal audit plan.
	The role requires requisite internal audit competencies with knowledge of business processes, the International Standard for the Professional Practice of Internal Auditing and other global standards.


Key Roles & Responsibilities


	Perform sections of assurance, consulting engagements, special requests, and management requests
	Prepare work programs for assigned sections of audits and other necessary documentation
	Communicate draft findings and recommendations through written reports to the Senior Internal Auditor
	Document audit work in concise work papers, collate observations, and communicate results per internal audit standards
	Propose and evaluate value-adding recommendations to strengthen internal controls, policies, and procedures
	Provide timely feedback to the Divisional Head, Business Process and Shared Services Audit, on engagement status
	Collaborate with audit team members to complete and close out each audit engagement
	Perform non-standard or ad hoc requests, including spot checks and investigations
	Handle administrative tasks as assigned by internal audit management
	Maintain the overdue actions database and liaise with process owners for implementation updates
	Plan and organize workload, manage multiple tasks, and adjust priorities as needed
	Execute other duties as directed by Internal Audit Management
	Use CAAT (Computer-Assisted Audit Techniques) tools for efficient project delivery
	Uphold Interswitch and professional ethical standards, ensuring audit activities align with International Standards for the Professional Practice of Internal Auditing and IIA Code of Ethics.


Experience and Qualifications Required


	First Degree in any business-related discipline (e.g., Accounting, Finance, Economics, etc.)
	3 - 5 years of internal and/or external audit experience in a reputable organisation
	ACA, CIA, CISA, or other relevant professional certifications are an added advantage
	Experience in a fintech or payment services firm, Big 4 professional services firm, bank, financial services, or technology company is an advantage
	Strong knowledge and application of best practice audit standards, modern audit techniques, and tools
	Proficiency in data analytics and continuous auditing is an added advantage
	Demonstrated understanding of common fraud schemes and red flags.

title: Personal Assistant to the Hospital Administrator Job at St. Dominic Catholic Hospital
content:
St. Dominic Catholic Hospital is a 64-bed hospital located in Ogungbade off New Ife road in Ibadan. St. Dominic Catholic Hospital is the vision of the Dominican Sisters of St. Catherine of Siena (Italy). We offer various medical services such as: General medicine, internal medicine, O & G, Laboratory, and Radiology, to mention just a few. The hospital is run in collaboration with foreign partners. We are registered and licensed by the Corporate Affairs Commission and the Ministry of Health. Also, we are accredited by the NHIS as both primary and secondary health care providers.
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Personal Assistant to the Hospital Administrator
Job Location: Ibadan, Oyo
Employment Type: Full-time
Reports to: Hospital Administrator

Job Summary


	The Personal Assistant (PA) provides administrative support to the Hospital Administrator, ensuring the smooth operation of the office and facilitating effective communication.


Key Responsibilities


	Manage the Hospital Administrator's schedule, including scheduling meetings and appointments.
	Prepare and distribute correspondence, reports, and other documents.
	Provide administrative support, including answering phone calls, responding to emails, and managing paperwork.
	Maintain accurate records and databases.
	Handle confidential and sensitive information with discretion.
	Coordinate travel arrangements, meetings, and events.
	Develop and implement administrative processes to improve efficiency.
	Liaise with staff, patients, and external stakeholders as required.


Requirements


	Strong administrative and organizational skills.
	Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
	Ability to maintain confidentiality and handle sensitive information.
	Proficiency in Microsoft Office and other administrative software.
	Previous experience as a PA or in a similar role.


Skills:


	Time management and prioritization.
	Attention to detail.
	Problem-solving and adaptability.
	Discretion and confidentiality.


Salary
N70,000 - N80,000 Monthly.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their Application Letters and CV to: adm.sdchib2019@yahoo.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.
